experiments.title: Data Understanding and Preprocessing
experiments.objective: Understand, find, explore, and clean up data. This includes handling formatting issues, outliers, duplicates, and performing normalization and standardization.

experiments.title: Parsing PDF Files with Python
experiments.objective: Develop a Python script to parse and extract data from PDF files using the pdfminer library.

experiments.title: Data Cleanup on a Real-World Dataset
experiments.objective: Develop a Python script for data cleanup on the 'child labour and marriage data.xlsx' dataset. Focus on checking for duplicates and missing data, and cleaning line breaks, spaces, and special characters.

experiments.title: Correlation Visualization with Matplotlib
experiments.objective: Draw a chart to visualize the relationship between perceived corruption scores and child labour percentages using the Matplotlib library.

experiments.title: Web Scraping for robots.txt
experiments.objective: Write a Python script to download and display the content of the robots.txt file from en.wikipedia.org.

experiments.title: Introduction to Tableau Visualizations
experiments.objective: Create a first visualization with Tableau software for various data file formats. Learn to create basic charts like line charts, bar charts, and tree maps using the 'Show Me' panel.

experiments.title: Advanced Tableau Calculations and Formatting
experiments.objective: Perform Tableau calculations like sum, average, and aggregate. Create custom calculations and fields. Explore advanced visualization formatting, tools, and menus for specific data calculations.

experiments.title: Editing, Formatting, and Pivoting Data in Tableau
experiments.objective: Learn to edit and format axes, manipulate data within Tableau, and utilize pivoting functionality for data transformation.

experiments.title: Data Structuring and Filtering in Tableau
experiments.objective: Master the techniques for structuring, sorting, filtering, and pivoting data to prepare it for effective visualization in Tableau.

experiments.title: Advanced Visualization Tools in Tableau
experiments.objective: Explore advanced visualization tools, including using filters, detail panels, size panels, customizing filters with tooltips, and applying color formatting to data.

experiments.title: Dashboards and Storytelling in Tableau
experiments.objective: Learn to create and design different interactive displays, and how to distribute and publish data using Tableau dashboards and storytelling features.

experiments.title: Creating Custom and Advanced Charts in Tableau
experiments.objective: Develop skills in creating custom charts, working with cyclical data, and implementing circular area charts and dual-axis charts for complex data representation.

experiments.title: Android Studio Setup & Basic Intents
experiments.objective: Install Android Studio, set up an Android Virtual Device (AVD), and develop an app with menu options to dial a number, open a website, and send an SMS using intents.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This example demonstrates how to use Intents to perform common actions like dialing a number, opening a website, and sending an SMS from an Android app.

codeSnippets.code:
<!-- activity_main.xml -->
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:padding="16dp"
    android:gravity="center">

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnDial"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Dial Number" />

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnWebsite"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Open Website" />

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnSms"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Send SMS" />

</LinearLayout>

experiments.title: Android Notifications and Toasts
experiments.objective: Develop a mobile app to insert notifications. On successful insertion, display a toast message to the user.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This code shows how to create a basic notification and a Toast message when a button is clicked. You need to create a notification channel for Android Oreo (API 26) and above.

codeSnippets.code:
<!-- activity_main.xml -->
<RelativeLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:padding="16dp">

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnNotify"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Show Notification & Toast"
        android:layout_centerInParent="true"/>

</RelativeLayout>

experiments.title: User Registration Screen
experiments.objective: Develop a mobile app with a registration screen. On submission, validate the user input and register the user.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A simple registration UI. The Java code performs basic validation to ensure fields are not empty before showing a success toast.

codeSnippets.code:
<!-- activity_main.xml -->
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:padding="16dp">

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/etUsername"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:hint="Username" />

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/etEmail"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:inputType="textEmailAddress"
        android:hint="Email" />

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/etPassword"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:inputType="textPassword"
        android:hint="Password" />

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnRegister"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Register" />

</LinearLayout>

experiments.title: User Login and Welcome Screen
experiments.objective: Develop a mobile app with login and welcome screens. On submission, validate the user details, and upon success, navigate to the welcome screen.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This example has two activities. `LoginActivity` validates hardcoded credentials and starts `WelcomeActivity` on success. This demonstrates basic multi-activity navigation.

codeSnippets.code:
<!-- activity_login.xml -->
<LinearLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    android:padding="16dp">

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/etEmail"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:hint="Email (user@example.com)" />

    <EditText
        android:id="@+id/etPassword"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:inputType="textPassword"
        android:hint="Password (password123)" />

    <Button
        android:id="@+id/btnLogin"
        android:layout_width="match_parent"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:text="Login" />

</LinearLayout>

<!-- activity_welcome.xml -->
<RelativeLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:padding="16dp">

    <TextView
        android:id="@+id/tvWelcome"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_centerInParent="true"
        android:textSize="24sp"
        android:text="Welcome!" />

</RelativeLayout>

experiments.title: Flutter SDK and Dart Project Setup
experiments.objective: Install and configure the Flutter SDK. Create a new Dart project using IntelliJ IDEA.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This is the standard "counter app" that is generated when you create a new Flutter project. It demonstrates the basic structure of a Flutter app with a stateful widget.

experiments.title: Navigation and Routing in Flutter
experiments.objective: Create a navigation and routing system for a sample 'Pizza Store' application in Flutter.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A basic example of navigating from a `HomePage` to a `PizzaPage` using `Navigator.push()`. This is the simplest form of routing in Flutter.

experiments.title: Password Reset Functionality in Flutter
experiments.objective: Implement a 'forgot password' option in the Pizza Store App, allowing users to reset their password via a link sent to their email.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This code provides the UI for a "Forgot Password" screen. It includes a text field for the email and a button. No actual email-sending logic is included.

experiments.title: User Profile UI with Firebase
experiments.objective: Create a user profile interface in a mobile application and integrate it with Firebase for data storage and retrieval.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A simple, stateless UI for a user profile page. This can be used as a starting point before integrating Firebase to fetch and display real user data.

experiments.title: Flask Environment and HTML Templates
experiments.objective: Set up a virtual environment for Flask and create HTML templates for a web application with various menu items.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A minimal Flask application that renders an HTML template. This shows the basic file structure with an `app.py` file and a `templates` folder.

codeSnippets.code:
Home | About | Contact

Welcome to the Home Page!

experiments.title: Handling Form Data with Flask
experiments.objective: Design an HTML form to get data from the client-side user. Access this data on the server using a POST request in a Flask application.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This Flask app has a single route that handles both GET (to display the form) and POST (to process the form data). The submitted name is displayed back to the user.

codeSnippets.code: Enter Your Name

experiments.title: Login and Welcome Pages in Flask
experiments.objective: Develop a web application with login and welcome pages using Flask. Validate user details on submission and navigate to the welcome page upon success.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A basic Flask login system. It uses `redirect` and `url_for` to navigate between the login and welcome pages. User details are hardcoded for simplicity.

codeSnippets.code:
Login Page

{% if error %}

{{ error }}

{% endif %}

Username:

Password:
Welcome, {{ user }}!

experiments.title: Simple Python Chatbot with Flask
experiments.objective: Implement a simple chatbot in a Flask web application that can answer Python-related questions from a predefined text file.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This is a very basic rule-based chatbot. The `responses` dictionary acts as our "text file" knowledge base. The app takes user input from a form and displays the corresponding response.

codeSnippets.code:
Simple Python Chatbot

{% if question %}

You asked: {{ question }}

{% endif %} {% if answer %}

Bot says: {{ answer }}

{% endif %}

experiments.title: Quadratic Equation and Prime Numbers
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to a) find the roots of a quadratic equation and b) print all prime numbers up to a given integer using BufferedReader.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: This file contains two separate classes: one for solving quadratic equations and another for finding prime numbers.

experiments.title: Palindrome and String Sorting
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to a) check whether a given string is a palindrome and b) sort a list of strings read from the command line.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: Checks for palindrome and sorts command-line arguments.

experiments.title: Method Overloading and Overriding
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to demonstrate method overloading and method overriding.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: Demonstrates compile-time (overloading) and run-time (overriding) polymorphism.

experiments.title: Packages and Abstract Classes
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to demonstrate a) packages and b) abstract class usage.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: Create a package `com.example` containing an abstract class and use it in another file.

experiments.title: Exception Handling
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to a) demonstrate exception handling and b) create a user-defined exception.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: Shows a standard `try-catch` block and a custom exception for invalid age.

experiments.title: Producer-Consumer Problem
experiments.objective: Write a Java program that implements the producer-consumer problem.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A classic multi-threading synchronization problem using a shared buffer.

experiments.title: Swings Events and Factorial
experiments.objective: Write a Swings program to a) handle mouse and key events and b) compute factorial value.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A simple Swing GUI that demonstrates event listeners.

experiments.title: Advanced Swing Components
experiments.objective: Develop a swing application using JList, JTree, JTable, JTabbedPane, and JScrollPane.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A tabbed pane showing various advanced Swing components.

experiments.title: Simple Calculator using Grid Layout
experiments.objective: Write a Java program for a simple calculator using a grid layout.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A very basic calculator GUI. Does not include calculation logic.

experiments.title: Servlet Parameters and Session Tracking
experiments.objective: Write a servlet for a) parameters passing and reading using an employee login page and b) session tracking using cookies.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A simple login servlet that reads parameters and sets a cookie for session tracking. Requires a Servlet container like Tomcat.

experiments.title: JDBC Operations
experiments.objective: Write a Java program to perform JDBC operations using the command line interface.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: Connects to a database, creates a table, inserts data, and retrieves it. Requires a JDBC driver (e.g., for MySQL or H2).

experiments.title: Servlet Database Connection
experiments.objective: Write a servlet that connects to the database, retrieves the data, and displays it.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: A servlet that fetches data from a database and displays it in an HTML table. Requires a JDBC driver and Servlet container.

experiments.title: Week 4: Basic Table Creation and Insertion Queries
experiments.objective: To understand and practice writing basic SQL DDL (Data Definition Language) and DML (Data Manipulation Language) commands by creating a schema for a small database and populating it with initial data.

contributions.author: Initial Contribution
contributions.content: SQL queries to create and populate the Sailors, Boats, and Reserves tables for a basic database management system.

codeSnippets.code:
CREATE TABLE Sailors (
    SID INT PRIMARY KEY,
    SName VARCHAR(20),
    Rating INT,
    Age FLOAT
);

INSERT INTO Sailors VALUES
(22,'Dustin',7,45.0),
(29,'Brutus',1,33.0),
(31,'Lubber',8,55.5),
(32,'Andy',8,25.5),
(58,'Rusty',10,35.0),
(64,'Horatio',7,35.0),
(71,'Zorba',10,16.0),
(85,'Art',3,25.5),
(95,'Bob',3,63.5);

experiments.title: Implementation of Logic Gates
experiments.objective: To verify the truth tables of basic logic gates (AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR) using integrated circuits (ICs).
